title: Diploma Claiming
question: How can I claim my diploma after graduation?
answer: Diplomas are available at the Registrar’s Office around 2–3 months after graduation. Please bring a valid ID and your clearance form.

title: Certificate of Enrollment
question: How can I request a Certificate of Enrollment?
answer: You can request a Certificate of Enrollment through the Registrar’s Office. Present your student ID and fill out the request form. Processing usually takes one working day.

title: Certificate of Grades
question: How can I get a Certificate of Grades?
answer: The Certificate of Grades can be requested at the Registrar’s Office or through the student portal if available. Prepare your student ID and complete the request form.

title: Form 137 Request
question: How can I request for my Form 137?
answer: Form 137 requests should be made personally at the Registrar’s Office. You will need to fill out a request form and provide your student details.

title: Enrollment Verification
question: How can I verify a student’s enrollment status?
answer: Verification requests should be sent via the Registrar’s Office with the student’s full name, ID number, and academic year. A processing fee may apply.

title: Student Clearance
question: How can I process my student clearance?
answer: Students must settle all library, laboratory, and accounting obligations before applying for clearance at the Registrar’s Office. Clearances are required for graduation and TOR release.

title: Correction of Student Records
question: How can I correct an error in my student records?
answer: Submit a written request with supporting documents such as a birth certificate to the Registrar’s Office. Processing may take 3–7 working days.

title: Certification Request
question: How can I request a Certification of Enrollment, Grades, or Graduation?
answer: Certifications can be requested at the Registrar’s Office. Fill out the request form, pay the corresponding fee, and wait for notification once ready for release.

title: Document Authentication
question: How can I request a certified true copy of my document?
answer: Bring the original document to the Registrar’s Office for verification. A certification fee is required.
keywords: certified true copy, authentication, document, registrar

title: Honorable Dismissal
question: How can I get my Honorable Dismissal?
answer: Submit a clearance form and fill out the request for transfer credentials at the Registrar’s Office. Processing usually takes 3–5 working days.
keywords: honorable dismissal, transfer credentials, registrar, records

title: Lost or Replacement ID
question: What should I do if I lost my student ID?
answer: Report the lost ID immediately to the Registrar’s Office. You will be asked to submit an affidavit of loss and pay a replacement fee.

title: Processing Time for Documents
question: How long does it take to process Registrar documents?
answer: Most documents such as certifications or TORs take 3–5 working days to process after payment. Some may take longer depending on verification.

title: Registrar Office Hours
question: What are the office hours of the Registrar?
answer: The Registrar’s Office is open from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, Monday to Friday, excluding holidays.

title: Registrar Contact Information
question: How can I contact the Registrar’s Office?
answer: You may contact the Registrar’s Office via email at registrar@sorsu.edu.ph or through the official SorSU Facebook page.
